rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a single Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a double Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

title: Yankee Doodle Bunnies - Triple Specialty Bunny

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple Specialty Bunny. Players that have three in The Bunny Circle may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose a Carrot from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose a Carrot from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose two Carrots from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 13 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 14 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 15 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 16 to survive.

rules.title: Holographic Bunny
rules.text: Magnetic Monopole can be used to kill the Holographic Bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 17 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 18 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 19 to survive.

rules.title: Mysterious Place
rules.text: The player who currently holds the Yellow Ball can control the destiny of this card. The opponent must play the card first, then the player holding the Yellow Ball may redirect it to any other player, bunny or the Discard Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 20 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the die and to take a number of flavor cards from the Draw Pile equal to the number rolled. The player does not draw again until he has less than seven cards.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Cards are drawn from the top of the Discard Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used by the first opponent to show the player a picture of a bunny on their phone to retrieve any bunny from Weil's Pawn Shop. The player may take any one of the opponent's bunnies already in The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: First, the player reads the card text out loud. Next, the player counts down (3 - 2 - 1 - Go!) and announces, "Bunny Bytes". Bunny Bytes may be used once by the first opponent to show the player a picture of a bunny on their phone to retrieve any bunny from Weil's Pawn Shop. The player may take any one of the winning opponent's bunnies already in The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to steal five saved Special or Very Special cards from his opponents.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The player may steal all of the cards from one or several different opponents, and may steal less than five cards if he chooses or if five cards are not available.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny. Funky Fungus Single raises the level of any weapon by one.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Funky Fungus modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny. Funky Fungus Double raises the level of any weapon by one.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Funky Fungus modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to force all players to sell their Metal cards and coins at the current Exchange Rate and to close Morden's Medals Exchange for one round of play. The shop opens again during the current player's next turn.

rules.title: Mysterious Place
rules.text: The player who currently holds the Yellow Ball can control the destiny of this card. The opponent must play the card first, then the player holding the Yellow Ball may redirect it to any other player, bunny or the Discard Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by all players to vote on which bunny in The Bunny Circle should be discarded. If a majority agree then the bunny voted is discarded. Voting starts with the player and proceeds clockwise.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to guess the month in which each of his opponents was born and to take one Carrot from any Kaballa's Market for each correct guess.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any single bunny in The Bunny Circle and prevents the bunny from forming a Bunny Triplet with any other bunnies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny. Lucky Horseshoe Heptdruple lowers the level of any weapon by seven.

rules.title: 50/50 Weapons
rules.text: 50/50 Weapons are not affected by Horseshoe modifiers.

rules.title: Gender Weapons
rules.text: Gender Weapons are not affected by Horseshoe modifiers.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Horseshoe modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Horseshoes and Hand Grenade
rules.text: Horseshoes and Hand Grenade can be used to kill Horseshoe Bunnies by forcing them to roll higher than their total number of horseshoes to survive.

rules.title: Bamboozled Blacksmith
rules.text: Bamboozled Blacksmith can be used to remove Horseshoes from a bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Metals may be bought or sold for the current Exchange Rate. All metal dice may be re-rolled at the end of any turn during which a player received a Carrot. The Exchange Rate for Silver is doubled.

rules.title: Bad Mood Ood
rules.text: Bad Mood Ood may be used to eliminate this card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to purchase a Violet item from any opponent for 5 Dolla: a Violet bunny, a Violet Pawn or a 'Whiner Senator Bunny Modifier card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by the first opponent to sort the cards in his hand numerically to exchange any unwanted cards in his hand for new ones from the Draw Pile.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: First, the player reads the card text out loud. Next, the player counts down (3 - 2 - 1 - Go!) and announces, "Order Sorter". Order Sorter may be used once by the first opponent to sort the cards in his five-card hand numerically (using the Card Identification Number) to exchange any unwanted cards in his five-card hand for new ones from the Draw Pile. The player may exchange any of the cards in his five-card hand for any cards discarded by the winning opponent.

rules.title: Mysterious Place
rules.text: The player who currently holds the Yellow Ball can control the destiny of this card. The opponent must play the card first, then the player holding the Yellow Ball may redirect it to any other player, bunny or the Discard Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows the player to roll the dice and to receive one Metal card or coin for each number rolled that is a perfect square (1 - 4 - 9 - 16).

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If no Metal cards or coins exist at Morden's Metals Exchange, then the player is out of luck. Players may not sell their new Metal cards or coins until their next turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to add the current Exchange Rates of the Gold, Silver and Copper at Morden's Metal Exchange and to spend that amount of Dolla at any open store.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Dolla earned with the Sacren Chalice of Rixx may not be saved. If no stores are open, then the player is out of luck.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any player which must feed the buffalo 5 units of any food (in any combination) or lose a Carrot. Buffalo continues visiting one player per round counter-clockwise around The Bunny Circle. If Buffalo encounters a player that has no food to offer, or not enough food, then it starves and is eliminated. Buffalo may be eliminated using any weapon.

rules.title: Bad Mood Ood
rules.text: Bad Mood Ood may be used to eliminate this card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to purchase a Yellow item from any opponent for 5 Dolla: a Yellow bunny, a Yelow Pawn or a Shiner Senator Bunny Modifier card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the die and to take the number of Water and Milk units equal to the number rolled from the discard piles.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The units may be all Water, all Milk or a combination of both that total the number rolled.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be given to any opponent who may not play an extra card from a Bunny Triplet. The player may pay 7 + 4 Dolla to discard Independence Day.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the die and to take a number of Cabbage and Radish units equal to the number rolled from the discard piles.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The units may be all Cabbage, all Radish or a combination of both that total the number rolled.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: The player with this card saved may use the units on any food small cards interchangeably. The unit numbers remain the same, however they may be used for any type of food (Radish, Milk, Cabbage or Water).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to exchange any one or two unit small card with a new one of the same type from the Draw Piles (if any exist). Newly drawn small cards may not be exchanged again.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to force any opponent who has just lost a bunny to roll the die and to lose another bunny (player's choice) if the opponent rolls an Even number. Must be used during the turn in which the first bunny was killed!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be given to all players simultaneously once a curse word is heard during play and forces the first player that utters the next curse word to discard one saved card of each category (if he has one): Special, Very Special, Zodiac, Mysterious Place, Bunderground Station and Relative. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: A curse (or naughty) word can only be defined by the people playing the game. Each group will have to decide for itself which words are not allowed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a left-handed player while the direction of play is counter-clockwise to immediately choose any five Carrots from Kaballa's Market. Or may be used immediately to eliminate Baseball Blues or Narcoleptic Dog. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a female player to automatically take the next turn of play thereby skipping all of the player's turns in between. Play continues in the same direction as before. May be used between any two player's turns!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny making it a Senator of the Shiner Party. All Senators are allowed to vote for Casting Terrible Misfortune cards.

rules.title: Campaign Contributions
rules.text: Campaign Contributions may be used to control the votes of this senator's party.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny making it a Senator of the Whiner Party. All Senators are allowed to vote for Casting Terrible Misfortune cards.

rules.title: Campaign Contributions
rules.text: Campaign Contributions may be used to control the votes of this senator's party.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: All Bunny Modifier cards under bunnies in The Bunny Circle are moved to the next bunny counter-clockwise.

rules.title: Heavenly Halo
rules.text: Counter-Clock Warlock is one of the few cards which can be used to remove The Heavenly Halo from a bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows the player wearing the largest shoe to take any three Metal cards or coins from Morden's Metal Exchange if he agrees to take a deep breath from inside his shoe. If the player refuses to participate then the player with the next largest shoe may participate (and so on).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: While water skiing in the Arctic Circle, one of your bunnies hits a frozen fjord!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: A Terrible Misfortune (Casting) card requires that all Shiner Senators and Whiner Senators vote to decide which bunny suffers the consequences. The bunny does not have to belong to the person who drew the card. Each player receives one vote per Senator Bunny they own. If two or more bunnies are tied on votes, then the player who drew the card decides which of the tied bunnies dies. If there are no Senator bunnies in play, then the player who drew the card decides which bunny in the Bunny Circle dies (it does not have to be his own).

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.

rules.title: Hanging Chad
rules.text: Hanging Chad can be used to turn a Casting Terrible Misfortune into a regular Terrible Misfortune

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: One of your bunnies caught his head in a mechanical rice picker!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: A Terrible Misfortune (Casting) card requires that all Shiner Senators and Whiner Senators vote to decide which bunny suffers the consequences. The bunny does not have to belong to the person who drew the card. Each player receives one vote per Senator Bunny they own. If two or more bunnies are tied on votes, then the player who drew the card decides which of the tied bunnies dies. If there are no Senator bunnies in play, then the player who drew the card decides which bunny in the Bunny Circle dies (it does not have to be his own).

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.

rules.title: Hanging Chad
rules.text: Hanging Chad can be used to turn a Casting Terrible Misfortune into a regular Terrible Misfortune

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This Metal card may be bought from or sold to Morden's Metals Exchange for the current Exchange Rate.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This Metal card may be bought from or sold to Morden's Metals Exchange for the current Exchange Rate.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This Metal card may be bought from or sold to Morden's Metals Exchange for the current Exchange Rate.
